data.text: @guy_hamil @CBCToronto The restrictions are coming off so that group will be happy. There is no actual push to get vaccinated for day-to-day activity now. They won't care if there are ads promoting it - they will just ignore them. There is a group that thinks it is too early. The ads are for them.

@JamesWoods888 @CBCToronto It’s now the minority that support keeping restrictions. The majority of people are sick of constantly hearing about Covid and restrictions. At this point everyone that wants a vaccine has gotten one. Again there is no reason to continue pushing them. It will lessen votes for him

@CBCToronto @JohnTory And how many reams of paper were actually used to print ALL of the Manufacturer's Trial Documents there Geniuses so people could actually read the literature to help them make an Informed Decision??
Oh, what's that, you didn't print these off to hand out to the uninformed people?

@guy_hamil @CBCToronto It's never about the money in politics - it's always about votes. Money is one of the tools they manipulate for votes - but it's for votes.

The reason to be seen as pushing vaccination still is to offset the hurt that some feel with restrictions being lifted. For the vote.

@CBCToronto @JohnTory Roll up that sleeve folks only 10more to go or maybe one every six months until you have no immunity left and #BigPharma hits a billion dollars. How much is your cut Johnny? https://t.co/oh7gh2qULo

@JamesWoods888 @CBCToronto Doug Ford is as liberal as anybody has ever been. He follows Trudeau and no one else. There is absolutely no reason to be pushing vaccination still when 90% of the population is vaccinated and cases are rapidly dropping. It always comes down to money and doses are expiring.

@guy_hamil @CBCToronto lol. Even if they give them direction, they don't supply the enthusiasm for recruiting people to be enthusiasm.

And as I said, we are in an election campaign where meddling by the feds would be called out when it is the opposite party.
@JamesWoods888 @CBCToronto If you don’t think the federal government dictates what the provincial government does especially on something like this you’re wrong.
